intro: Cochlearia changhuaensis, commonly known as the Changhua cochlearia, is a flowering plant species native to Taiwan. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant is characterized by its small, showy flowers that typically bloom in early spring. It has basal leaves that are rosette-shaped and are covered in fine hairs. Cochlearia changhuaensis is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats, thriving in well-drained soils.
